website_summaries.verdict: The Type A 6 from Saucony offers a lot of service for athletes who have a neutral gait. It’s lightweight, affordable and agreeable to the natural performance of the foot. It’s a solid option for mid-tempo training. Though it received a few negative feedback, the shoe has still proven to be an excellent road partner.
pros: The Open Mesh of the Type A 6 ensures a lightweight and breathable coverage that’s comfortable
Flex Film is a set of overlays that are inconspicuous, yet efficient in securing the foot in place, according to a few testers
The SSL EVA is a premium mid-sole unit from Saucony that’s lightweight and very capable of providing durable support and rebound
The XT-900 is a carbon rubber material that can be found throughout the outsole unit and it gives traction to the runner
The IBR+ or Injected Blown Rubber offers additional cushioning in the forefoot area of the outsole, making sure that every toe-off is as efficient as possible
The men and women’s versions of the Type A 6 have lightweight natures
cons: The Saucony A 6 works well for many activities, but its durability was criticized by some reviewers when taken to longer races
Others felt that the forefoot area was too narrow for them

customer_reviews.title: Update is not good for my feet
customer_reviews.text: The type A5 is my favorite shoe ever. I can't get them in my size anymore, so I decided to try the A6. I hate the fit. They are longer and much narrower than the A5. The first time I wore them, they pinched my feet, causing top of the foot pain that lingered for days. I have read reviews that say the sole is better on these. Maybe. The A5s have very poor traction when wet. I haven't worn the A6s in the rain, so I can't really compare. I hate them.
customer_reviews.author: Prof

customer_reviews.title: We purchased her a pair last year and she loved them. This year when it was time to ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter runs cross country. We purchased her a pair last year and she loved them. This year when it was time to shop for running shoes again, she only wanted another pair. She says no other shoes feels as good as these do when running. She runs an average of 15 miles a week.
customer_reviews.author: rfgd

customer_reviews.title: Great for racing/short runs
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for speed work and recommend them for shorter runs (<6 miles) or races. They are very lightweight and low-profile. The bright colors are vibrant and fun. I wore them on one long run (10 miles) and my shins and calves were very sore afterward.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M.

customer_reviews.title: Too skinny for Minnie
customer_reviews.text: Love the color and they are incredibly lightweight, but they are sized way too small. No bought the same size as my current Saucony running shoes which fit like they were custom made just for me, and once I got my foot in, it was like a boa constrictor was squeezing the life out of my foot. Very narrow shoe...even for a medium width.
customer_reviews.author: cynthia j. ayers

customer_reviews.title: Love Saucony shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I find time to run everyday - as a hobby and for fitness, but recently I have decided to take it a step further and register for a 10K challenge. I decided it that it would be great if I can have lighter shoes for race day and I picked these since I love Saucony shoes. This pair feels lighter than expected, perfect fit (I'm a 6.5 for the Saucony Ride 7 as well) and I'm so excited to run in them! So comfortable and fast - I love this pair.
customer_reviews.author: HJP

customer_reviews.title: Run Small
customer_reviews.text: These run small in the toes and take some wear before they give a little. Love the color. I can't wear for extended period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie W.R.

customer_reviews.title: So worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Gift for daughter who had this same pair and gave 4 times the price for the first pair from a local athletic store.
customer_reviews.author: Jammie L. Harper

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, fun color combo
customer_reviews.text: These are some of my favorite running shoes. Lightweight, not too squishy, perfect for my long power walks.
customer_reviews.author: Alyson Davis

customer_reviews.title: Flat and fast!
customer_reviews.text: Took these for an easy run. It quickly became a tempo race. These shoes are fast! Only drawback is there does not seem to be a lot of traction. Wouldn't run in rainy or similar condition.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Kar

customer_reviews.title: and I thought the A5 was the best..
customer_reviews.text: and I thought the A5 was the best.... they have out done themselves. A6 is a great racing shoe, light weight, yet supportive. Love Saucony shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy L. Joly

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for gym class for teen age daughter. They served her well.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Norberg

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes! Lightweight, easy to put on, great shoes. Slightly on the narrow side, but just a touch.
customer_reviews.author: Anikó

customer_reviews.title: Love saucony!
customer_reviews.text: Some of my favorite minimal shoes! I have done road running, trail running and light hiking in them.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny J

customer_reviews.title: Narrow
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a half size larger because I saw a comment about it being narrow, but I should have gone a whole size larger because my toes are right at the end of the shoe. I have loosened the laces quite a bit to alleviate the "squeezing" and it has been tolerable.
customer_reviews.author: D. A. Bosford

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. Love how light weight they are.
customer_reviews.author: SSD518

customer_reviews.title: Like this shoe and just wear right now for casual ...
customer_reviews.text: Like this shoe and just wear right now for casual dress. I have foot issues and it works around those for me. Liz Ellis
customer_reviews.author: oe

customer_reviews.title: Light weight racing flat
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and light weight. Still feel different to my type A5 but probably just need to get used to them. Love this new colour. Better than the previous option in A5.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: I love the way these shoes look
customer_reviews.text: I love the way these shoes look. The colors are bright and vibrant. The fit is a little small. My only real complaint is the price.....these shoes are awesome and they're comfortable. ..but I just don't really see them holding up for a long time. The construction is a little cheaper than I expected for the price I paid. They aren't very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: katie beach

customer_reviews.title: Great Running Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoe for any distance. Lightweight and comfortable. I've worn them for short runs and long ones (20+ miles)
customer_reviews.author: Helki Weber

customer_reviews.title: Narrow for Saucony
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy Saucony's because their toe box runs wider than most competitors. This shoe runs narrow for a Saucony shoe so i'm returning it. I also realized that the "natural" running shoe doesn't have nearly enough support for me. I did love the way the shoe looked, so i'm disappointed that i can't use it.
customer_reviews.author: mkctn

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shoe for my daughters cross country meets. She loves them!
customer_reviews.author: Janet W.

customer_reviews.title: Light as a feather but with very good support
customer_reviews.text: This shoe has the typical well-made construction you'd expect from Saucony. I would review the size as a tad small. I ordered up one half size and the fit is perfect. This shoe is so light and comfortable I sometimes wear the shoes without socks. For a serious walk, socks are needed of course. The weight is light but support is adequate, much more support than the lightweight Nike Free. The color is very bossy, which I love.
customer_reviews.author: Paula G Cothren

product_meta.title: Type A 6
product_meta.description: A light and responsive racing shoe might be just what you need to snag that qualifying time. The underfoot feel and amount of impact protection provided by the compressing materials between the foot and running surface. The level of pronation control built into the shoe. Pronation is the inward rolling of the ankle through the gait cycle. The difference in height between the heel thickness and forefoot thickness of the shoe.Features:*Improved lightweight FLEXFILM overlays for better support*Water drainage ports to quickly remove water*SSL EVA midsole for extra comfort*XT-900 traction outsole with IBR+
feature_bullets: Lightweight and responsive racing shoe featuring lightweight upper with FlexFilm overlays
Water drainage ports for quickly removing water
SSL EVA midsole for extra comfort
